title: Who is better, Billy Joel or Elton John? - Quora

response.answer_text: I like both Elton John’s and Billy Joel’s music. They are both great singers (or at least Elton John used to be), but I think Joel is the better singer overall (just my opinion). As a pianist, I would have to say Elton John is a better musician. Even Billy Joel admits he’s a better organ player than pianist, and as one person put it comparing the two instruments, “Piano acts as an introducer and a leader in a composition, whereas an organ works more as a follower than a leader”(Koshal, 2011), which brings me to my next and more important point… Both are also great songwriters, but contrary to popular belief, both had a lot of help along the way despite the names that appear on their Albums and the marquees. Most people know lyricist Bernie Taupin was/is a long-time collaborator of Elton John’s, but Billy Joel’s band in the 1970’s and 1980’s put him on the map (and kept him there when his label was going to dump him). Musicians like the late Doug Stegmeyer (bass player), Liberty DeVitto (his drummer of 30+ years) et al who helped arrange Billy Joel’s songs. According to other studio musicians, Devitto in particular had a knack for elevating mediocre songs Joel came up with to greater heights. Even some of his most iconic hits like “Just the Way You Are” and “Only the Good Die Young” were highly influenced—and made considerably better—by the drummer. As Kenny Aronoff put it (drummer for John Mellencamp et al.), Liberty DeVitto was “one of those guys who made the band he was in. Billy Joel sounded like Billy Joel because of Liberty DeVitto—the ‘Keith Richards’ of that band.” Similarly, what would Elton John’s songs be like without Bernie Taupin’s lyrics? So Billy Joel and Elton John are both as similar as they are different in a lot of ways. They also both have their strengths and weaknesses (like Billy Joel throwing his loyal bandmates and friends out like they were trash from time to time). Interestingly enough, despite touring together in the past, Elton John and Billy Joel are allegedly bitter rivals since 2010 or so (at least that’s what I’ve read). That said, their music will likely outlive us all, and that’s also a testament to the musicians that helped them along the way (and I hope they don’t completely forget that). So who is better really comes down to personal taste. I tend to favor Billy Joel, but that doesn’t make me right. It’s hard to pick between Rocket Man and Just the Way You Are. But if you’re going to hold my feet to the fire, I’m going to say ABBA. ;)

Better at what? If you mean better as an artist it’s down to personal taste. I’m not a huge fan of either, although I have several albums of both. I would generally say I preferred Billy, as I think his songs resonate with me more. As a pianist Elton is better. He was a session musician before he was famous. As a singer Billy has a better voice now, Eltons having been rather wrecked in the 70s. As a song writer Elton has co-written more and more of these have been hits. However, he doesn’t write on his own, he nearly always uses a lyricist (mostly Bernie Taupin), except, from memory, Song for Guy, which is almost entirely instrumental. Billy writes lyrics as well as music, and certainly We Didn’t Start The Fire is one of the cleverest lyrics ever.
